member.name: P:Utilities.GenericParser.TextQualifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used to enclose a string that would otherwise be potentially trimmed (Ex. " this ").
member.value: The character used to enclose a string, so that row/column delimiters are ignored and whitespace is preserved.

remarks.para: The Text Qualifiers must be present at the beginning and end of the column to have them properly removed from the ends of the string. Furthermore, for a string that has been enclosed with the text qualifier, if the text qualifier is doubled up inside the string, the characters will be treated as an escape for the literal character of the text qualifier (ie. "This""Test" will translate with only one double quote inside the string).
Setting this to can cause a performance boost, if none of the values are expected to require escaping.
Default: '\"'
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.

member.name: P:Utilities.GenericParser.EscapeCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that is used to escape a character (Ex. "\"This\"").
member.value: The character used to escape row/column delimiters and the text qualifier.

remarks.para: Upon parsing the file, the escaped characters will be stripped out, leaving the desired character in place. To produce the escaped character, use the escaped character twice (Ex. \\). Text qualifiers are already assumed to be escaped if used twice.
Setting this to can cause a performance boost, if none of the values are expected to require escaping.
Default: null
If parsing has started, this value cannot be updated.

member.exception: Attempting to modify the configuration, while parsing.
